cells.data:
git branch <branch name>
  This allows you to create a new branch off of your current repository,
  Using git status also tells you which branch you are currently on

git checkout <branch name>
  This allows you to switch between branches

git checkout -b new-branch-name
  This will create your new branch and switch you into a the new branch all
  at the same time.

git merge
  It is important to be currently working on your target branch before merging
  branches.

git fetch
  This will update your local repository with all the branches that are loaded on
  GitHub.

DONT USE GIT FETCH UNLESS YOU DONT WANT TO MERGE
  Git pull gets all of the branches and merges them locally on your machine

git push -u origin <branch name>
  This is for when you first push a new branch
